page.title: 02OUR AREAS ORIGINS
page.content: Effingham is a{Saxon}word. Its meaning is "THE SON OF A LEADER'S VILLAGE IN A VALLEY."i.e. "Effa": the name of the leader. "Ing": descendant, son of, or valley. "Ham": village. Effingham is in{central Surrey.}The soil to the north is{clay,}to the south,{chalk}separarted by{gravel. } Where East Horsley joins Effingham there are traces of{flint mining. } HORSLEY'S ORIGINS Horsley is an Anglo Saxon name meaning "horse meadow". In Saxon times Horsley provided 100 fighting men for the king. in the 20th Century Horsley has changed from a small country village into a dormitory settlement for London.
